sentence.Network_en: To improve hand-eye co-ordination, practise throwing and catching balls.
sentence.Network_cn: 要想提高手眼协调能力，就练习投球和接球。

sentence.Network_en: Catching colds is unfortunately an occupational hazard in this profession.
sentence.Network_cn: 不幸的是，容易感冒是这个行业的职业性风险。

sentence.Network_en: Police say they are confident of catching the gunman.
sentence.Network_cn: 警方说他们有信心抓住那个持枪歹徒。

entry.tran: (疾病)有传染性的，容易传染的
entry.def: If an illness or a disease is catching, it is easily passed on or given to someone else.

example.ex: There are those who think eczema is catching.
example.tran: 有人就是认为湿疹会传染。

entry.tran: (情感等)有感染力的，感染性强的
entry.def: If a feeling or emotion is catching, it has a strong influence on other people and spreads quickly, for example through a crowd.

means.word_mean: 1. (baseball) playing the position of catcher on a baseball team
2. the act of detecting something; catching sight of something

sentences.sentence: "the contracting of a serious illness can be financially catastrophic"

means.word_mean: 1. (of disease) capable of being transmitted by infection

auth_sentence.content: Specialists said catching illness early would improve treatment chances.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Specialists said catching illness early would improve treatment chances.

auth_sentence.content: People have pictured them catching fish or eating clams.
auth_sentence.res_content: People have pictured them catching fish or eating clams.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: People have pictured them catching fish or eating clams.

auth_sentence.content: Now the rest of the world is catching on.
auth_sentence.res_content: Now the rest of the world is catching on.

Sentence.sentence: The internet makes information billionaires out of all of us, and the architects of our online experiences are catching on to the need to make things creatively difficult

sentences.en: Flu is catching,so stay away from work.
sentences.cn: 流感是会传染的,所以别去工作了。
